channel.title: CSS Units :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: When specifying CSS rules, you often need to provide a unit of measurement. Any time you provide a measurement in a CSS rule, you must provide the units that measurement is being expressed in, following the value. For example: #banner { width: 300px; }sets the width of the element with id banner to 300 pixels. There are actually a lot of units available in CSS, and weâ€™ll summarize the most common in this section.
